pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9258423483/job/25468454786)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9258423483/job/25468455225)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9258423483/job/25468455540)

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion weightSpace M ((-n : ℤ) • α + β : L → R) ≠ ⊥ := by ```
These two docstrings are identical. I guess you want `s/first/last/` in the first docstring?

Also, I would start the docstrings with `The .. weight`.
```suggestion
/-- The last weight in an `α`-chain through `β`. -/
noncomputable
def chainTop (α : L → R) (β : Weight R L M) : Weight R L M :=
  ⟨chainTopCoeff α β • α + β, weightSpace_nsmul_add_ne_bot_of_le α β le_rfl⟩

/-- The first weight in an `α`-chain through `β`. -/
```
Should we have analogous lemmas for `chainBot`?
I don't think this is possible in the general case. For example `chainBot α α` will be zero if `-α` is not a weight (or will this never happen)?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebra/Lie/Weights/Chain): More API for chains.
